complaint_summary: Review applications filed against the orders of the Bench dated 30-04-1975, challenging the application of the Amnesty Order of 22-12-1971.
investigation_summary: The Amnesty Order commuted death sentences to life imprisonment for cases pending execution before its notification. The High Court confirmed the death sentences before the Amnesty Order was issued.
judgment_summary: The court dismissed the review applications, holding that the Amnesty Order applied to all cases where death sentences were confirmed by the High Court before its notification, regardless of pending appeals in the Supreme Court.
punishment: Death sentences commuted to imprisonment for life under the Amnesty Order.
legal_arguments: Advocate-General argued that the Amnesty Order applied only to cases pending execution and not to appeals pending in the Supreme Court.
Court held that the Amnesty Order's language was unambiguous and applied to all cases where death sentences were confirmed by the High Court before its notification.
statutes: Article 161 of the Constitution of Pakistan
key_issues: Application of Amnesty Order to cases pending in Supreme Court

legal_terms.Amnesty Order: An executive order commuting death sentences to life imprisonment for cases pending execution.

words_and_phrases.Pending execution: Refers to cases where death sentences were confirmed by the High Court but not yet executed.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the interpretation and application of the Amnesty Order dated 22-12-1971. The court dismissed the review applications, affirming that the Amnesty Order applied to all cases where death sentences were confirmed by the High Court before its notification, irrespective of pending appeals in the Supreme Court. The judgment emphasized the unambiguous language of the Amnesty Order and rejected the Advocate-General's contention that the Supreme Court was not an 'ordinary criminal court' under the Order.
